temples.name: Abu Simbel
temples.description: Temples of Ramesses II, relocated due to the Aswan Dam.

temples.name: Kouklia
temples.description: Palaepaphos - Worship of Aphrodite with Egyptian Influence.
temples.note: Aphrodite’s temple here may have had connections to Egyptian fertility goddesses (Hathor, Isis). Egyptian artifacts and Bronze Age trade links found in the region.

temples.name: Temple of Horus at Edfu
temples.note: Built under Ptolemaic rule, this temple blended Greek and Egyptian architectural styles while honoring Egyptian deities.

temples.name: Kom Ombo
temples.note: A unique double temple built during the Ptolemaic period, dedicated to both the crocodile god Sobek and the falcon god Haroeris.

temples.name: Rome
temples.note: After the conquest of Egypt in 30 BCE, Rome absorbed its wealth, culture, and even obelisks, placing them in public spaces. The Temple of Isis in Rome became a major religious center.

temples.name: Seis
temples.note: Plato wrote that Egyptian priests in Sais told Solon the story of Atlantis.
